author: ralexstokes
content: anyone have a rationale for "unbundling" the `getPayload` endpoint from the Engine API from the `getBlobsSidecar` endpoint so that a block producer must call both to assemble a valid message for gossip?

author: ralexstokes
content: looking at the builder specs for this and wondering what the arguments are on each side

author: henridf
content: update: Nimbus is now ok with starting from post-Bellatrix.

author: acolytec3
content: Has there been any discussion about what all fields are required in JSON when submitting a blob transaction over RPC via `sendRawTransaction`?  I was just looking at our code again following the above and we currently allow (but don't require) blob txns from RPC to have blobs and commitments but dont even look for the aggregateKzgProof.  We do validate all 3 following the EIP when we get a serialized one gossiped in the mempool but don't do so for local transactions received from RPC and the EIP doesn't specifiy anything here unless I'm missing it. In theory, the EL client could just require the blobs and then construct the commitments, proofs, and versioned hashes itself but not sure what Geth/Nethermind are doing for this

author: roberto.bayardo
content: I believe the mdehoog/geth prototype expects them to be computed by the tx submitter.

author: acolytec3
content: cool, easy enough to enforce that

author: acolytec3
content: one follow-up question, I'm assuming the EIP is saying this in other words but we should always provide the `network wrapper` version of a transaction when gossipng over devp2p and reject an inbound tx that is the minimal version?

author: roberto.bayardo
content: that's been my assumption

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: If the 4844-devnet breaks it might be because the geth fork doesn't have the wei-> gwei change (just fyi)

author: inphi
content: is the gwei harmonization change in geth's master branch? We recently merged the master to the 4844 fork.

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: no its on withdrawals-timestamp

author: inphi
content: gotcha. thanks for the heads-up.

author: inphi
content: When providing withdrawals payload attributes via engine API, what's the behavior of EL clients if the withdrawals array field is omitted? Should the client return an error or treat that as an empty array?

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: Return an error I think. There's a difference between empty withdrawals and withdrawals not set

author: inphi
content: Agreed. But the withdrawals root is included either way in the block header. So why not default to an empty list if it's unspecified in the payload attributes?
